messages: 1d3bfcfde5ac540a616a25dff751e36f (12:23): henry: was just chatting to mike, i see this as an important question- if we want to have aria conforming when used with html5 what will be required by HTML5 to be in the aria spec to achieve this?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (12:24): it's Henri fwiw
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (12:24): also, 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e already said what was required, no?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:25): 1d3bfcfde5ac540a616a25dff751e36f: clear (and sensibly non-empty) conformance criteria both for UAs and authoring
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:26): by non-empty I mean that clearly hte expectation of the PF about UA behavior is something more than what the PF have put in the spec
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (12:27): It seems like it would be useful to have a discussion with RichS and Michael Cooper about what needs to be added to the spec
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (12:27): (they're the editors, as I recall)

1d3bfcfde5ac540a616a25dff751e36f (12:27): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: I think i understand, but i didn't get that the PF are going to provide that, I think it would be useful to have is a few roles/properties documented in a form that would pass the the criteria, is it possible to provide this or help me to do so?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (12:28): maybe aaronlev can help with making it clear what needs to be done, as far as spec'ing out the UA conformance criteria
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:28): there has been progress on stuff getting written down
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:29): but it's written down outside the document that is being advanced along the REC track
1d3bfcfde5ac540a616a25dff751e36f (12:30): ok so the stuff aaron is doing is the way it needs to go
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (12:30): well, then it seems like that needs to be incorporated into the actual spec
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:30): 1d3bfcfde5ac540a616a25dff751e36f: I don't have strong opinion on the title of the document that lays out the criteria
1d3bfcfde5ac540a616a25dff751e36f (12:30): so it dosn't need to be in the spec?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:30): but if it's not the ARIA spec, then HTML5 should probably reference the doc that actually contains the info
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:30): summons 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:31): I'll move back to the PF room now
1d3bfcfde5ac540a616a25dff751e36f (12:31): wehther html5 references aria is not important is it? rather that the use of ARIA is conformant in HTML5
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (12:32): I wonder what the ARIA spec is then? lol
1d3bfcfde5ac540a616a25dff751e36f (12:32): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: thats a question for the editors
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (12:33): I haven't followed exactly, but it seems that if the ARIA spec does not actually define ARIA it's mostly moot
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:33): looks up

a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (13:32): f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb: Would a pharmacy in France sell shower gel?
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (13:33): if you go to pharmacy in France, you will get only drugs. pharmacy = medical stuff only. or expensive body care stuff.
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (13:33): you will find body care in any kind of small supermarket
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (13:33): There should be one around Mandelieu La Napoule.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (13:33): That's what I was guessing, mainly
